Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

In a blatant power-grab yesterday, the Pennsylvania Senate amended a provision into the administrative code bill that would eliminate the governor's three appointments to the Pennsylvania Sentencing Commission and give them to the legislature and judiciary — both of which already have appointments to the commission. This could upend vital work that ACLU of Pennsylvania members and other allies have been engaged in to stop the Sentencing Commission from implementing policies that drive mass incarceration and racial biases in the criminal legal system.

Our only chance to stop this blatant power-grab is a veto by Governor Wolf.

The makeup of the Sentencing Commission is critical. Because the Sentencing Commission is comprised of appointees from each of the three branches of government and both sides of the aisle, we can count on the commission to listen to Pennsylvanians like you. When thousands of ACLU members and other allies spoke up last year and ultimately defeated a risk assessment algorithm steeped in racist data, it was because the commission listened to you and stood up against a policy that would have driven mass incarceration.

The good news is, together we can stop this.

Call Governor Wolf now at 717-787-2500 and tell him to veto H.B.1461 — and restore the balance of power on the Sentencing Commission.

You can also go to Governor Wolf's social media accounts and tell him to veto H.B.1461:

  • Governor Wolf on Facebook.
  • Governor Wolf on Twitter.
  • Governor Wolf on Instagram.

Thank you for taking action and ensuring that we move forward — not backward — in addressing Pennsylvania's mass incarceration crisis.

Thanks for sticking with us,

Elizabeth Randol
Legislative Director, ACLU of Pennsylvania
